data.text:
Princess Rima (Rima Ghali, born 2 June 1966) is an Egyptian-born Brunanter princess.

Biography[]

Early life[]

Rima was born to Fathia Ghali, daughter of King Fuad I of Egypt and Nazli Sabri, and Riyad Ghali in California in the United States, where she grew up. She has three older sisters. Her parents divorced in 1973 and her father tragically killed her mother while drunk in 1976.

Brunant[]

Ghali arrived in Brunant by chance as she was accepted to the political science program at the Grijzestad University before her other applications. She came to Brunant in 1984 and graduated with high marks in 1988. After a few years of working at a law office in Koningstad, she got her citizenship and a job at the Brunanter government. In 1997, she joined the Brunanter delegation to the United Nations.

Marriage and children[]

Rima met her future husband, Prince Hendrik, in 1999 at a dinner event in Koningstad. The couple announced their engagement in March 2000 and they were married on 22 March 2001. They have two daughters:

Miranda Van Draak (born 10 August 2001)

Nadia Van Draak (born 24 November 2005)

Hendrik is the eldest child of Princess Angela, a daughter of King Marten II and Maria Benedita of Portugal. The prince has another daughter from his previous marriage with politician Sofia Andersen, Juliana Van Draak (born 1991).

Later career[]
